get.description: Retrieves a list of alerts from one or more data sources for a specific period

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
Start and end time during which logs are to retrieve. Format: ISO 8601 timestamp to the millisecond in UTC, yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.mmmZ.
If both start and end are not specified, the request retrieves logs within five minutes before the point of time when the request is sent.
If both start and end are specified, the request retrieves logs within the configured duration. Make sure the end time is no earlier than the start time.
If only start is specified, the request retrieves logs within five minutes after the point of the configured start time.
If only end is specified, the request retrieves logs within five minutes before the point of the configured end time.

parameters.name: investigationStatus
parameters.description: If All statuses are selected, leave it as null; otherwise, put an array of integer(s); [0]: New; [1]: In Progress; [2]: Resolved: True Positive; [3]: Resolved: False Positive

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: "investigationStatus" / "score" / "wbName" / "wbId" / "createdTime" / "severity"; if it is desc, add a prefix "-" (Ex: "-investigationStatus")

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 0-based (0 means the 1st record; 50 means the 51st record)

get.description: Retrieves a list of enabled and disabled detection models

post.summary: Enable or disable a detection model
post.description: Changes the status of the detection model to either allow or prevent the model from triggering alerts
Retrieves information of agents (computer IDs and user accounts) that match the specified company ID and criteria
Retrieves information of endpoints that match the specified computer IDs
Retrieves information of an endpoint that matches the specified computer ID

get.description: Retrieves operating system information for all agents active in the last seven days

get.summary: Search Observed Attack Techniques event list
get.description: Retrieves a list of events in the Observed Attack Techniques app that match specified criteria

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: riskLevels
parameters.description: Array of risk levels to include in the results

parameters.name: tacticIds
parameters.description: Array of tactic IDs to include in the results

parameters.name: techniqueIds
parameters.description: Array of technique IDs to include in the results

parameters.name: filterNames
parameters.description: Array of detection names to include or exclude (prefixed with "-") in the results

parameters.name: nextBatchToken
parameters.description: Encoded string used to request the subsequent events

get.description: Retrieves the status (enabled or disabled) of two-factor authentication for local accounts
Retrieves a list of roles that users can select when configuring accounts

delete.description: Deletes an account from the XDR service platform

post.description: Creates a SAML or local account

put.description: Configures the account password using the link in the verification message

post.description: Sends a verification message with a link to a password configuration screen

delete.description: Deletes the authentication token of an account with API access

get.description: Generates an authentication token for an account with API access
Exports log entries that match specified criteria

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: Page index of audit log query result in paginated format

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of audit log returned in each page

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description:
Filter log for certain access type
* 0 - Console
* 1 - API
* 9 - All

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description:
Filter log for certain categories, format "01|02|03", categories definition is as following
* 01 - Logon
* 02 - Single Sign-On
* 03 - Account Management
* 04 - Product Connector
* 05 - SIEM Connector
* 06 - Detection Model Management
* 07 - Workbench
* 08 - Response
* 09 - Search
* 0c - Mobile Security
* 0d - Network Inventory
* 11 - Third-party Integration

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort log ASC or DESC, default is DESC
* asc - sort by ASC
* desc - sort by DESC

delete.description: Disconnects an on-premises product from the XDR service platform

patch.description: Modifies the description and product subtype of an on-premises product that is connected to the XDR service platform

get.description: Retrieves a list of SaaS products that XDR supports and their corresponding information on the Customer Licensing Platform

post.description: Connects a SaaS product to the XDR service platform

delete.description: Disconnects a SaaS product from the XDR service platform

patch.description: Modifies the description of a SaaS product that is connected to the  XDR service platform

get.description: Retrieves the status (enabled or disabled) of single sign-on for SAML accounts

put.description: Enables or disables single sign-on for SAML accounts

get.summary: Download Trend Micro XDR service provider SP metadata file
get.description: Downloads the Trend Micro XDR service provider (SP) metadata file required for SAML 2.0 single sign-on configuration

post.description: Sends a test notification to the specified email address address

get.description: Retrieves a list of webhook requests sent to company applications

post.description: Creates a new webhook request for a specific Trend Micro Vision One app or feature (Note. Any application that supports custom JSON should be able to consume Trend Micro Vision One webhook requests. However, Trend Micro does not guarantee support for all applications and recommends that you test each implementation before use in a production environment.)
Sends a test request to all webhook URLs for a specific Trend Micro Vision One app or feature

delete.description: Deletes information about a specific webhook request using the webhook ID

get.description: Retrieves information about a specific webhook request using the webhook ID

put.description: Updates information about a specific webhook request using the webhook ID

get.summary: List roles used in company accounts
get.description: Retrieves a list of roles used in company accounts and their corresponding permissions
Retrieves the permissions of all roles for all XDR features

get.summary: Get permissions of a specific role
get.description: Retrieves the permissions of a specific role for all XDR features
Retrieves information used to configure the Splunk connector

post.summary: Add to block list multiple objects
post.description: Adds multiple file SHA-1, IP address, domain, or URL objects to the User-Defined Suspicious Objects List, which blocks the objects on subsequent detections
Adds a file SHA-1, IP address, domain, or URL object to the User-Defined Suspicious Objects List, which blocks the objects on subsequent detections

Compresses a file on an endpoint in a password-protected archive and
then sends the archive to the XDR service platform

Note: This API is disabled by default. If you would like to use the API, contact your support provider.
Deletes a message from a mailbox

get.summary: Get download information for collected file
get.description: Retrieves a URL and other information required to download a collected file
Retrieves information about a specific response task

post.description: Disconnects an endpoint from the network (but allows communication with the managing Trend Micro server product)

get.description: Retrieves a list of response tasks

post.description: Moves a message from a mailbox to the quarantine folder
Removes a file SHA-1, IP address, domain, or URL object that was added to the User-Defined Suspicious Objects List using the "Add to block list" action
Restores network connectivity to an endpoint that applied the "Isolate endpoint" action
Terminates a process that is running on an endpoint
Submits a file to the sandbox for analysis (Note. For more information about the supported file types, see the Trend Micro Vision One Online Help.)

get.description: Retrieves the maximum number of files that you can submit to the sandbox per day (Note. Objects with a "Not analyzed" risk level do not count toward this quota.)
Retrieves the analysis report, investigation package, or Suspicious Object List of a submitted file

schema.example:
{
  "analysissummary": [],
  "digest": [],
  "reportid": "ID used to get the report and suspicious object. Empty means no report.",
  "taskid": "ID to get the sample analysis status.",
  "taskstatus": "When the status is finished, could check analysisSummary to get the analysis result."
}

get.description: Retrieves the status of a submitted file

post.summary: Search for data and list all results
post.description: Searches data sources using specified query criteria and retrieves a paginated list of matching records

post.summary: Search only the Detections data for matching records
post.description: Searches the "Detections" data using specified query criteria and retrieves a paginated list of matching records

get.description: Retrieves information about domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs that are in the Suspicious Object List

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: last query's last record info,value in previous query response's nextLink

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: so size returned in one response, maximum size is 1000, default value: 1000

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: so type, the value could be ["domain", "ip", "sha1", "url"], use comma as separator to add multiple values. by default, response would contain all so type

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: filter the so whose lastModified time is larger than the startTime. ISO Format: 2021-03-21T03:08:40Z

parameters.name: contentFilter
parameters.description: filters the list to suspicious objects that exactly match the specified string

post.summary: Add objects to Suspicious Object List
post.description: Adds domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs to the Suspicious Object List

post.summary: Delete objects from Suspicious Object List
post.description: Deletes domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs from the Suspicious Object List

get.description: Retrieves information about domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs that are in the Exception List

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: last query's last record info,value in previous query response's nextLink

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: so size returned in one response, maximum size is 1000, default value: 1000

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: so type, the value could be ["domain", "ip", "sha1", "url"], use comma as separator to add multiple values. by default, response would contain all so type

post.description: Adds domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs to the Exception List and prevents these objects from being added to the Suspicious Object List
Deletes domains, file SHA-1 values, IP addresses, or URLs from the Exception List
Retrieves a list of alerts in the Workbench app

get.description: Retrieves information about the specified alert

put.description: Modifies the investigation status of the specified alert

delete.description: Deletes a note from the specified alert

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Note IDs, use common-separated if more than one ID

get.description: Retrieves notes of the specified alert

post.description: Adds a note to the specified alert
